tweet:
I’m looking forward to working with @RepLucyMcBath to do more when it comes to preventing gun violence. That’s why I’m excited to announce that we will hold our first ever gun violence prevention event with @RepLucyMcBath this year in the 6th District.

There’s no time to waste.

When I looked up to the House Gallery, I saw @MomsDemand. I was able to vote for this measure - but it's the work from regular people and grassroots organizations who have tirelessly advocated for gun violence prevention that got us here today. pic.twitter.com/mGp3m21sx0

25 years.

That's how long it's been since the House has passed a major bill on gun violence prevention.

Today we changed that. I was proud to support H.R. 8, a measure that requires universal background checks for all gun sales. #EndGunViolenceNow
Her advice: America is great, and our greatness comes from our partnerships and respecting our friends and allies internationally. Thank you for your continued leadership, @madeleine

Today I had the privilege of meeting former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright. It was an honor to hear her testify in @HouseForeign where she emphasized the importance of Congress’ role in the accountability and oversight of the President’s foreign policy. #HFAC pic.twitter.com/qZxsQFfp20

To create a greener future, we have to start from the ground up. The creation of the Appalachian Forest National Heritage Area, part of the package to protect our #PublicLands passed yesterday, will help preserve and restore Maryland's forests. This is a big win #ForThePeople. pic.twitter.com/dwJEGL8x15
Grateful that @RepCummings is leading @OversightDems today. The American people deserve to hear Michael Cohen's testimony and make their own judgement.

Democrats and Republicans just voted to block President Trump's #FakeEmergency to build a southern border wall. I am proud to be a co-sponsor of this legislation.

Now it's up the Senate. We must all stand together against this unlawful act.
Fair pay is good for business and simply the right thing to do. Happy to support #PaycheckFairness today! https://twitter.com/EdLaborCmte/status/1100473638355156992 …

Trump’s #FakeEmergency makes America less safe by stealing billions from crucial military construction projects that ensure our troops have the essential training, readiness & quality of life necessary to do their jobs effectively. We must stand up against this unlawful action.
I'm ready to make some #GoodTrouble under your leadership @repjohnlewis https://twitter.com/repjohnlewis/status/1098976584306954240 …
I'm looking forward to fighting for the American worker on the Joint Economic Committee. See my full statement below: pic.twitter.com/Grg0Gc1W4I

Mental health is so important when it comes to addiction treatment services. Thanks for having me today in Allegany County @WesternMDHealth and for all of the work you’re doing when it comes to addressing the addiction crisis. https://twitter.com/WesternMDHealth/status/1098352217239810048 …

It may be snowing but that won’t stop us from listening and learning about some of the ways groups are addressing the opioid epidemic in Western Maryland. 

People out here are pulling together and we need Congress to do the same to #EndtheAddictionCrisis pic.twitter.com/5qzKljWk0I

I stand with the @ACLU. This action by the President violates the Constitution and the separation of powers. https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2019/02/19/president-trump-sued-aclu-over-national-emergency-order/2920734002/ …
President Trump's emergency declaration is unlawful and unconstitutional. I applaud @BrianFrosh for taking this necessary action. https://twitter.com/BrianFrosh/status/1097667896958955520 …

This #PresidentsDay, let's take a look at the long tradition of both Democratic and Republican Presidents welcoming refugees to the United States.

No other nation has stepped up to fill the gap left by current U.S. policy. We need better moral leadership. pic.twitter.com/OUfKB9TNJw
See my statement on President Trump declaring an unlawful national emergency: pic.twitter.com/CvSRsLAVRi
Let’s get to work. Let’s #EndtheAddictionCrisis pic.twitter.com/DFBV4q6Wpu

This day feels surreal for me. In 2016, I lost my nephew Ian to a fentanyl overdose at the age of 24 after five years of working with him to get treatment from some of the best programs and therapists possible.

No family deserves to suffer the loss of a loved one to addiction.

The numbers are devastating:

- 192 people die every day from drug overdoses
- Last year over 70,000 people died from drug overdoses
- Americans are now more likely to die from an opioid overdose than a car crash

This cannot continue. We must come together to end this crisis.

This bipartisan group of freshmen will bring fresh eyes to one of the most devastating crises facing our country. We will:

- Learn from experts and stakeholders
- Visit institutions focusing on research and treatment
- Promote legislation to tackle the epidemic

It’s time to take action.

That’s why today I'm announcing the formation of the Freshmen Working Group on Addiction. 36 Democrats and Republicans from the freshman class have come together in this group to focus on promoting policies to #EndtheAddictionCrisis pic.twitter.com/DZXBJdrGUX

One of the students who lost his life that day was Joaquin "Guac" Oliver. This 3D statue shows him with a flower in his hand, a tribute to the Valentine's Day gift he had for his girlfriend. Today especially we remember the toll of gun violence, and the innocent lives it takes. pic.twitter.com/JYMxWxTJer

17 people were killed one year ago today in the #ParklandSchoolShooting. May we never forget those who lost their lives and their families who continue to  fight for commonsense gun reform in their memory. #MSDstrong #NeverAgain

What is happening in Yemen must end. Over 60,000 lives have been lost, and the impact is real and painful.

I spoke today in support of the Resolution to remove U.S. Armed Forces from Yemen. Congress did not authorize this action and we must remove ourselves from this conflict. pic.twitter.com/t2NaLsiP4p

Today in the @EdLaborCmte we talked about #PaycheckFairness and how investing in policies that ensure equity between women and men is simply good for business. 

When women are paid less than men, it hurts our families, our businesses, and our communities.

Corruption, plain and simple. We need to end the way Washington does business. That's why I'll never take a dime from PACs or lobbyists. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/12/climate/david-bernhardt-endangered-species.html …
Couldn’t ask for a better neighbor! Thanks @RepRaskin and your team for all of your help as we get our office up and running. https://twitter.com/RepRaskin/status/1095087403914706944 …

To be clear, AIPAC is a bipartisan organization that supports the US-Israel relationship, and Israel is a progressive, democratic beacon of light in the Middle East. Comparing AIPAC to the NRA shows a serious lack of listening and learning.

The U.S. and Israel have a strong bond because of our shared democratic interests and values, and the use of prejudicial tropes is both deeply hurtful and ill-informed. I agree with @SpeakerPelosi that Rep. Omar should apologize. https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/1095026564503343104 …
It makes me sick to my stomach that active-shooter trainings are now a fact of life for our kids. https://bethesdamagazine.com/bethesda-beat/active-shooter-training-to-reach-all-schools-by-june/ …
Wise words we’d do well to heed. June and I send our deepest condolences to @RepDebDingell https://wapo.st/2Sw2YQj
Beautiful Saturday in Hagerstown holding my first “Office Hours.” We met with more than 50 people. I learned a lot, and we’re already getting to work helping folks. pic.twitter.com/aKYOrHY6wz

Yesterday I met the new Ambassador of India to the United States, Harsh Vardhan Shringla. Ambassador Shringla is a brilliant diplomat and was previously the Indian High Commissioner to Bangladesh. It was excellent meeting him and I am glad to now call him a friend! pic.twitter.com/P454uxbwIp

Olympic gold medal hockey player @skrooops28 started playing hockey at age 4 in Rockville. I’m wishing her good luck in the U.S. Women’s National Team’s upcoming series against Canada! pic.twitter.com/akiLQ400Bv
My daughter was named at the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh. I knew many families there. We must stand up against anti-Semitism and stand with the Jewish people #SOTU
Modern border security means increased funding for technology, surveillance, border patrol officers, and immigration judges. Not a fifth century wall. #SOTU

We can and must work together to address our broken criminal justice system that disproportionally affects minorities and people of color. The bipartisan First Step Act was a great start - and we must do more. #SOTU19
We must do both. Legislate on issues of common ground and investigate issues of corruption. #SOTU19

The Trump Administration’s tax cut helped the wealthy - and they don’t need the help. To put it simply, the Trump administration has failed the middle class. #SOTU19 https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-tax/new-tax-law-is-fundamentally-flawed-and-will-require-basic-restructuring …

Tom Wibberley, another Maryland 6th District resident, is at the #SOTU19 tonight. Tom lost his son Craig at the age of 19 while he was serving our country abroad. We honor Craig and his father Tom tonight for their sacrifice for our country.

We have to take this strength that we have here in Hagerstown and spread it across Maryland and across the United States.

Mr. President - please help lead us tonight and speak about this catastrophe to give it the attention it deserves.

Literally thousands of Brookes all over America are being claimed by this epidemic. My nephew Ian was one of them. He died at the age of 24 from a fentanyl overdose.

This is not a tragedy of just Hagerstown or Maryland, it’s the most important tragedy that America faces. pic.twitter.com/5xG86MsHlA

I’m honored to have Kevin Simmers as my guest to the #SOTU19 tonight. Kevin lost his daughter Brooke to an overdose at the age of 19. He took action after that tragedy and today officially opened Brooke’s House - a safe living facility for women seeking treatment from addiction. pic.twitter.com/ti1MUWFgSu
We must support the press and the work they do to report the truth. Their work is more important now than ever before. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1092255028566523904 …

Phil who? The real weather predicting groundhog is right here in the 6th district. #MD06 https://www.times-news.com/news/photos-western-maryland-murray-sees-shadow/article_fb37276c-26f0-11e9-ba7a-63717cc308dc.html …

I am proud to recognize Frederick Dentist Dr. Harvey Levy who, as a part of National Children’s Dental Health Month, provided free dental care to 50 under-served children today. pic.twitter.com/CkVqXMV2Op
